lexUnit.name: escape.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: break free from confinement or control

sentence.text: The military said it had launched a big manhunt for army coup leaders who escaped when their men surrendered .
` This man helped me to escape when I was a prisoner , " Marian pleaded , ` he is no enemy to me . "
How could he be trying to escape when he was already chained ?
In an 1879 article , the eminent lawyer , journalist and essayist Walter Bagehot agreed that any attempt by women to escape what he regarded as their biological destiny was anti-evolutionary .
She only escaped when a passer-by heard her screams
During the 1921-23 Civil War , more than 100 prisoners escaped when a mine blew a hole in the perimeter wall .
The dog , who lives in Langton Walk , Darlington , had escaped when the postman forgot to close the garden gate .
AN ice-cream van driver and his assistant escaped when their vehicle was fire-bombed as they served customers in the Ballieston area of Glasgow .
The following morning , she caught the first flight out of Lisbon on one of the old KLM Dutch airliners , which had escaped the clutches of the Nazis to work the Portugal-England route .
And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
Opponents lucky enough to escape Malawi to live in exile have sometimes been hunted down and assassinated or abducted by Malawian agents in Zambia or Zimbabwe .

Steele escaped only weeks ago from Edinburgh prison and turned up in London where he glued himself to the railings at Buckingham Palace to protest his innocence before being re-arrested. escape , Steele telephoned the Daily Record newspaper .
The word escaped her in a small explosion of sound .
Mark escaped unscathed thanks to a fast-talking Indonesian who was with him on the expedition .
Leave it all behind you and cross the bridge beneath the restaurant that will help you escape south-west towards open country .
A solitary tear escaped his eye , and he cursed himself for it .
A soft giggle escaped Juliet .
Two were recaptured by police but four escaped across fields .
One who sought sanctuary was a Milanese noble called Landriani , who was pursued to the columns , but escaped inside the convent .
If the cell was sealed off and no gases escaped then all of the power would go into heating the electrolyte .
Horrified residents escaped over back garden fences as the flaming petrol cascaded down the street .
Police say the man escaped across fields after what they said was a despicable attack .
He escaped by car .
Ivor Stokle and Pauline Leyshon managed to escape from the car , but suffered horrific burns .
A family of three escaped from a house fire in Bardon Road , Berwick Hills , Middlesbrough , yesterday afternoon .
Outside in the shadowy corridor was the little frog which had escaped from the potion laboratory .
Why ca n't leopards escape from zoos ?
Her laughter escaped in little gusts and rushes .
All three men escaped in a red Metro car .
Officials stressed that no radiation had escaped into the atmosphere and there was no danger to the environment .
With a violent shout Orlick jumped over the table and escaped into the night .
The male assistant handed over a small sum of money and the robber escaped on foot towards Marton Road .
Four people sustained minor injuries and the van burst into flames ; the two people believed to have carried out the attack , however , escaped on a motorbike .
Sometimes a large semi-circle of white sheets was constructed at the end of the drive to stop the tiger escaping past the guns .
An armed response unit reached the bank within minutes and a police helicopter hovered overhead , but the robber had escaped through the back of the building empty-handed .
It turned out that Killion had been in the cellar when the police came , and he escaped through a trapdoor into the street .
The family escaped to Chester and then settled , much impoverished , on their mother 's jointure estates in Yorkshire .
Two teenage boys in the Rover Metro GTA 16-valve car escaped without injury .
Far better to relax in your favourite armchair , enjoy a drink with your husband ( or wife ) and talk through today 's problems than escape with a mate for endless rounds of gin and tonic .
We had to escape without being spotted .
Her hair escaped in wayward fronds from beneath her brown velvet hat , and her eyes , of the same brown , were full of friendliness .
There 's another screech of brakes , and a van that should never have escaped out the scrapyard collapses shuddering in the road .
Charley and I escaped up the chimney , but Noah was caught .

Built from the debris of planets , moons and comets , the sphere had originally been designed to completely enclose its star , collecting all the energy it gave out rather than letting the vast majority of it escape away into space .
If they were to escape back through the trench they would have to move quickly ; any moment now the sepoys would have crossed the yard from the hospital and outflanked them .

Much of the mercury that escapes in to the soil and the air and in to the water , finishes up here in the rivers , and there it reacts with naturally occurring compounds to form a compound called methyl mercury which is far more dangerous to man than is mercury itself .
` He was giving a couple of lectures on how you dodge arrest , but if you 're caught , then how you escape . "
